intro: Apocynum pictum, commonly known as the showy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, which attract various pollinators. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its stems are woody and covered with a milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. Apocynum pictum typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
